events.originalText: Drone attacks on major processing facilities at Abqaiq and Khurais forced Saudi Arabia to cut more than half of its oil production.
events.subtitle: Abqaiq–Khurais attack
events.headline: Drone attacks force Saudi Arabia to cut oil production by more than half

events.originalText: Physicists of the LIGO and Virgo projects first observed gravitational waves, the existence of which was predicted by Henri Poincaré in 1905.
events.subtitle: LIGO
events.headline: Physicists observe gravitational waves predicted by Henri Poincaré

events.originalText: Late-2000s financial crisis: The Northern Rock bank received a liquidity support facility from the Bank of England, sparking a bank run—the United Kingdom's first in 150 years.
events.subtitle: 2007–2008 financial crisis
events.headline: Northern Rock bank receives liquidity support from Bank of England, sparking UK's first bank run in 150 years

events.originalText: President Kumba Ialá of Guinea-Bissau was deposed in a bloodless military coup.
events.subtitle: Kumba Ialá
events.headline: President Kumba Ialá of Guinea-Bissau deposed in bloodless military coup

events.originalText: The Constitutional Court of Bosnia and Herzegovina declared the breakaway Croatian Republic of Herzeg-Bosnia to be unconstitutional.
events.subtitle: Croatian Republic of Herzeg-Bosnia
events.headline: Constitutional Court of Bosnia and Herzegovina declares Croatian Republic of Herzeg-Bosnia unconstitutional

events.originalText: Typhoon Sarah dissipated after causing extensive damage along an erratic path across the Western Pacific, killing 71 in Taiwan, the Philippines, and the Gotō Islands.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Sarah (1989)
events.headline: Typhoon Sarah dissipates after causing extensive damage in Western Pacific, killing 71

events.originalText: Afghan president Nur Muhammad Taraki (pictured) was overthrown and later killed on the orders of Hafizullah Amin, who succeeded him.
events.subtitle: Nur Muhammad Taraki
events.headline: Afghan president Nur Muhammad Taraki overthrown and killed on orders of Hafizullah Amin

events.originalText: At a conference held in Baghdad, the governments of Iran, Iraq, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and Venezuela founded OPEC to help coordinate their petroleum policies and influence global oil prices.
events.subtitle: Baghdad
events.headline: OPEC founded by Iran, Iraq, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and Venezuela in Baghdad conference

events.originalText: World War II: Nazi forces began a mass extermination campaign against the civilian residents of around 20 villages on the Greek island of Crete, eventually killing more than 500 men.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Nazi forces begin mass extermination campaign on Greek island of Crete

events.originalText: Hungarian forces massacred at least 150 ethnic Romanians in Ip, Transylvania, following rumors that Romanians were responsible for the deaths of two soldiers.
events.subtitle: Ip massacre
events.headline: Hungarian forces massacre ethnic Romanians in Ip, Transylvania

events.originalText: HMAS AE1 (pictured), the Royal Australian Navy's first submarine, was lost at sea; its wreck was not found until 2017.
events.subtitle: HMAS AE1
events.headline: Royal Australian Navy's first submarine, HMAS AE1, lost at sea

events.originalText: Theodore Roosevelt became President of the United States at age 42, the youngest person ever to do so, eight days after William McKinley was fatally wounded in Buffalo, New York.
events.subtitle: Theodore Roosevelt
events.headline: Theodore Roosevelt becomes youngest President of the United States at age 42

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Little Rock campaign ended with the Union Army capturing Little Rock, Arkansas.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Army captures Little Rock, Arkansas, ending the Little Rock campaign

events.originalText: Under the terms of the Calendar (New Style) Act 1750, the British Empire adopted the Gregorian calendar, skipping 11 days of the month.
events.subtitle: Calendar (New Style) Act 1750
events.headline: British Empire adopts Gregorian calendar under Calendar (New Style) Act 1750

events.originalText: António Manoel de Vilhena, Grand Master of the Knights Hospitaller, laid the first stone of Fort Manoel in Malta.
events.subtitle: António Manoel de Vilhena
events.headline: Grand Master of Knights Hospitaller lays first stone of Fort Manoel in Malta

events.originalText: A coalition of native Irish, led by Niall Glúndub, failed in their attempt to drive the Vikings of the Uí Ímair from Ireland.
events.subtitle: Gaelic Ireland
events.headline: Native Irish coalition, led by Niall Glúndub, fails to drive Vikings from Ireland

events.originalText: Domitian, the last Flavian emperor of Rome, was confirmed by the Senate to succeed his brother Titus.
events.subtitle: AD 81
events.headline: Domitian confirmed by Senate as last Flavian emperor of Rome
